The folder name in the archive has a space in the name. When you copy it into ~/Library/Application\ Support it needs to be renamed "minecraft", without the space in the name. The space is clearly visible if you copy the folder from the shell rather than in Finder.

@busta5000

i had the same problem but with another torrent try using mcpatcher

just download it and press the ''+'' button search the single player commands download and dubbel click it than press the ''patch'' button and it should work! 

oh! and make shure that the single player commands is in a .zip file in your mod folder,

you can find the mod folder in your mincraft folder

and you can compress a file into a .zip by simply opening the singleplayer commands folder and selecting everything, right click and choose the ''archive'' button,

For those ppl who can't get this to work. You need to go back to the minecraft folder, click on the name and take out the space that's at the end. That will make you be able to play offline ^_^

@Anmack  i just downloaded it and works fine for me, you have to use the login and passwrd thats already there, itll say log in fail but it will give you the option to play offline.

I made an account just to share this (hopefully) useful piece of info. 

I was having the same "not downloaded" issue as a few other commenters and it took me an embarrassing amount of time to realize I had put minecraft in the wrong App Support folder. Make sure you have it in the one under Users/{UserName}. 
The game is working great now! 

When all else fails, follow the directions. Ha!
